long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Printing from your Chrome desktop browser or Chromebook with the Ricoh myPrint IPPS Printer Extension

ABOUT
This extension brings printing functionality to your Chrome desktop browser or Chromebook device. If you're at an organization where myPrint is already installed, just add the extension to your Chrome desktop browser and start printing.

REQUIREMENT
The extension requires connection to a myPrint server of your organization or school. 
The deployment, properties and preferred parameters can be managed by your organization’s network administrator. The installation and configuration may have been set for you; therefore some functions may not be available. 
For system information, please contact your local network administrator.

FEATURES
Ricoh myPrint version 2.13 or higher:
•	Print by using your personal Ricoh myPrint ID.
Ricoh myPrint version 2.17 or higher:
•	Print by using your Google Account credentials.
•	Print as a guest. A PIN is sent to your mailbox to release the print job.

CONFIGURATION
Connecting the extension:
•	Click the extension icon and select "Configuration".
•	Enter the web address of your organization's myPrint into the Website configuration field.
•	Select login with your Google account* or your personal Ricoh myPrint ID, enter your personal details and submit to confirm.

Note: If the main account that you use to login to your organization's myPrint website is not your Google account email address, you first need to add your Google email address alias. Email aliases can be found on your "myProfile" page at your organization's myPrint website.

Google analytics:
•	No personal data will be collected. By default, the web address, the number of installations and the overall number of prints made by the extension are collected. 
•	Deselect if you do not consent to sending anonymous data to Google Analytics.

VERSION HISTORY
Version 1.0.7
•	First release.
Version 1.0.8
•	When printing from Google Docs, the orientation setting was not always set. This fix requires also an update to Ricoh myPrint 2.18.
Version 1.0.9
•	Added the ability to add predefined print queues to the Chrome extension. This feature requires also an update to Ricoh myPrint 2.19.
Version 1.0.10
•	The extension has been upgraded from Manifest V2 to Manifest V3.
